name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. The Curtis Publishing Co.

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Stearns, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. The Curtis Publishing Co.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment of the court below is affirmed on the able and comprehensive opinion of President Judge Hargest.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harry F. Stambaugh, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him James H. Duff, Attorney General, for appellant.
Chas. W. Hull, with him Geo. Ross Hull, of Hull, Leiby & Metzger, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. The Curtis Publishing Co.
Argued November 29, 1943.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Stearns, JJ.
Harry F. Stambaugh, Special Deputy Attorney General, with him James H. Duff, Attorney General, for appellant.
Chas. W. Hull, with him Geo. Ross Hull, of Hull, Leiby & Metzger, for appellee.
January 3, 1944:
